questions.question_text:
Universal Containers (UC) requested that branch managers and UC branch staff should only see customers and related information in their geographic location.

Which options should be used together to achieve the requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. is correct because it combines the use of Role Hierarchy to define the organizational structure and create sharing rules to enforce access restrictions based on geographic location.

B. is wrong because a user with system admin or 'Modify All Data' permission can see it. Even in a private sharing model, any user, regardless of location, may be able to see if added to an account team. It opens access, but doesn't limit.

A. is incorrect because solely configuring organization-wide defaults and creating sharing rules might not ensure that only branch managers and branch staff see customers and related information in their geographic location. It doesn't take into account the hierarchical structure of the organization, which is crucial for ensuring that access is appropriately restricted.

choices.B: Create the Account Team and add branch manager team members, and configure organization-wide defaults of the Account object.
choices.C: Configure Role Hierarchy and create sharing rules.
choices.A: Configure organization-wide defaults of the Account object and create sharing rules.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Private: No access by default, must grant explicitly
Public Read/Transfer: Everyone can view, but editing restricted
Public Read/Write: Everyone can view and edit

Goal is to have RESTRICTED editing capabilities but BROAD viewing capabilities. This last requirement is crucial - we need to RESTRICT visibility for some users, which means we cannot use either Public Read/Transfer or Public Read/Write as our OWD. If we used either of these, Service users would automatically see ALL accounts, including Prospects, which violates our requirements. C. is the correct answer bc it doesn't allow Service users to see records that they shouldn't. We can build access with sharing rules.

Selected Answer: C
As per the basic algorithm for OWD , There is at least 1 record which at least 1 user should not see. That is, Service users should not see accounts where recordtype != Prospect. Hence, OWD should be Private.

comments.content: Im wrong, it should be private. Reason being, you cannot restrict RT access through profile settings for access (You can for creation). Therefore, a private sharing model alongiwth sharing rules

discussion.content: Do not see an option for Public Read Only but that should be it

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers would like to control access to records and objects according to the following business requirements:
• Sales users can view all account records but only edit their own records.
• Sales managers can view all account records but only edit records of their team.
• Service users can view all account records that are not marked with a RecordType of Prospect.

Which organization-wide default configuration should an architect recommend to fulfill these requirements?

choices.C: Use sharing rule to share opportunities with the assistant agent.
choices.B: Use apex sharing to share and unshare opportunities with the assistant agent.
choices.A: Use opportunity team and create an assistant field, use apex to share opportunities with the assistant agent.
choices.D: Use share group to share opportunities with the assistant agent.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct. Apex is the only way to share a record with a user defined in a lookup field. 

A is incorrect because it's overly complex. You could use both if the org has already adopted opportunity teams, but that wasn't specified in the question. C is wrong as you cannot share records to a user defined in a lookup field. D is wrong as share groups are used to expose records owned by high-volume portal users. 

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=platform.managing_the_sharing_model.htm&type=5

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers (UC) is implementing Sales Cloud. During the last quarter of the financial year, sales agents help each other close deals. They requested a solution in Salesforce to allow them to specify an assistant agent on the opportunity record. When the sales agent changes the assistant field, the system should automatically remove access from the previous assistant and grant access to the new assistant.
What is the optimum solution to meet the requirements?

choices.B: The report owner and any users who have been given access to the “My Private Reports” folder.
choices.A: The report owner and users with the View All Data permission.

questions.question_text:
A support representative at Universal Containers created a report to view all her open cases that have been created in the past seven days and saved the report in the “Private Reports” folder.

Who can view and run the report?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. is correct

The reports or dashboards in a private folder are always invisible to everyone except the person who created the folder. 

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.analytics_sharing.htm&language=en_US&type=5#:~:text=The%20reports%20or%20dashboards%20in,view%20the%20reports%20or%20dashboards.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: A
Account Teams allow you to define a standard set of users who need access to accounts.
You can set up a default account team that automatically gets added to new accounts
This approach maintains proper security boundaries without overextending permissions

Why not C.?
Sharing rules are based on record criteria, not on the need for collaboration (clue: no criteria is mentioned)
They would need constant maintenance as support needs change
They don't provide the granular role-based access that Account Teams offer

Selected Answer: A
if the owner doesn't change, it should be the account team. C is a bit odd, this question doesn't give any criteria needed for sharing.

choices.C: Create a criteria-based sharing rule to grant access to other users.
choices.B: Create a permission set with View All Data and assign to supporting users.
